article.title: About Saxon/C
article.p: Saxon/C is a cross-compiled variant of Saxon from the Java platform to the C/C++ platform, with extensions for PHP and Python. All features of Saxon have been ported, other than those (such as collations) that are necessarily platform dependent. In particular, Saxon/C provides processing in XSLT, XQuery and XPath, and Schema validation. It therefore makes these processing capabilities available to a plethora of other languages that are strongly coupled to C/C++ such as PHP, Perl, Python, and Ruby. (For instance, saxon-node uses Saxon/C to create an interface with Node.js.)

Saxon/C 1.2 is built from the Saxon 9.9.1.5 Java product using Excelsior JET Enterprise 15.3 edition (MP1). The APIs support the current W3C Recommendations: XSLT 3.0, XQuery 3.1, XPath 3.1 and Schema Validation 1.0/1.1. See the Saxon 9.9 documentation Standards Conformance section for full details.

Saxon/C is released in three separate editions, as on the Java platform: the commercial products Enterprise Edition (Saxon-EE/C) and Professional Edition (Saxon-PE/C), and the opensource product Home Edition (Saxon-HE/C). See the feature matrix to compare the features of the HE, PE and EE products.
Versions are available for the following platforms: Linux 64-bit, Mac OS and Windows 64-bit. (Note that from Saxon/C 1.2 versions are no longer available for 32-bit systems.)
